The Human Condition by Hannah Arendt
Basically she talks about the three forms of human activity - Labor, Work and Action. She criticizes Marx for not differentiating Labor from Work. For her, Labor is about fulfilling the biological needs of the body (animal laborans) while work involves fabrication and changing the material reality (homo faber). Both are incomplete forms of human activity because they are both driven by necessity. Action which is similar to speech involves participation in the shared world. Through this participation we can exist in our specificity and uniqueness and engage others in a dialogue for the betterment of our shared world.
--- The German Ideology by Karl Marx
Its a good summary of Marxist thought. He criticizes his old group of friends (Young Hegelians) for being disillusioned idealists and do not realize that everything is due to the material forces. From this idea, he goes on discussion the origins of private property and the division of labor.
